content:
WASHINGTON — Under fire for an ongoing showdown over funding for Homeland Security, Speaker of the House John Boehner said Sunday it’s not easy to lead his rambunctious Republican caucus.

Conservatives dealt Boehner a stunning defeat Friday by rejecting a three-week funding measure for the department, which set Congress scrambling to avoid a shutdown before midnight.

Asked whether he can lead the Republicans, Boehner said, “I think so. I’m not going to suggest it’s easy. Because it’s not.”

“But remember what’s causing this,” Boehner said on CBS’s “Face the Nation.” “It’s the president of the United States overreaching.”

Conservatives want to block funding for President Obama’s executive action on immigration as a condition to fund the department. In the tense Friday vote, 52 Republicans voted no, joining with most Democrats who want a longer-term bill with no immigration strings attached.

Ultimately, the House and Senate agreed Friday to a one-week extension.
title: Boehner says it’s not easy leading Republicans
